meanings.definition: A person who is owned by someone else and is forced to work for them.
meanings.sent1: The ancient king had many slaveys who worked in his palace.
meanings.sent2: The slaveys on the plantation toiled under the scorching sun all day.
meanings.sent3: The wealthy merchant treated his employees like slaveys, making them work long hours for little pay.
meanings.sent4: In the fairy tale, the evil sorcerer enchanted the prince, turning him into a slavey to do his bidding.
meanings.sent5: The image of the chained slaveys on the ship haunted the young boy's dreams.

meanings.definition: A person who is excessively servile or submissive.
meanings.sent1: The villain's henchman was a slavey who obeyed every command without question.
meanings.sent2: She always felt like a slavey to her demanding boss, never daring to speak up.
meanings.sent3: The pampered poodle acted like a little slavey, following its owner everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The dictator's followers were like blind slaveys, blindly following his every order.
meanings.sent5: The character in the play was portrayed as a slavey, constantly bowing to the whims of others.

meanings.definition: To work very hard or toil.
meanings.sent1: The farmers slaveys in the fields from dawn till dusk to harvest the crops.
meanings.sent2: She had to slaveys over her school project all night to finish it on time.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to slaveys in the kitchen to prepare the elaborate feast for the royal banquet.
meanings.sent4: He would slaveys away at his desk, determined to finish the report before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The ants slaveys tirelessly to gather food for the winter months ahead.
